afterTest().Description: Extract logcat buffer to a file after test run.

clearLogcat().Description: Clear the current logcat buffer. This can be called from test method code, but will alter the results of the @B_org#junit#Rule_E@'s final log of the buffer at the end of the test method.

getDefaultLogFileName().Description: Return the default log file name for this rule class. A null return value indicates the rule doesn't log to a file.

beforeTest().Description: Clear logcat buffer prior to test run.

Parameters: String: where Logcat output is sent
dumpLogcat(java.lang.String).Description: Dump the current state of the logcat buffer to a file in the test method's logging directory. This method can be used when writing tests to record logcat at different points in time.

ClassDesc: When applied to a test class this Rule attempts to clear the Logcat buffer on the device before test method execution. The @B_org#junit#Rule_E@ then collects everything in the Logcat buffer after test method execution and logs it to a file on external storage. The default file location is maintained at @B_android#support#test#rule#logging#RuleLoggingUtils#getTestDir_E@. The TestRule performs these actions through calling the device's logcat command. Test methods can perform additional clearing and capturing of the Logcat buffer through the @B_android#support#test#rule#logging#LogLogcatRule#clearLogcat_E@ and @B_android#support#test#rule#logging#LogLogcatRule#dumpLogcat_E@ methods. Usage: \@Rule public LogLogcatRule mLogLogcatRule = new LogLogcatRule();
